chargeHist.descr: Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury

result.execSummary:
The defendant Erick Darnell Glenn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resist Officer - Substantial Bodily Harm/Soft Tissue Injury [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(2r).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: The Court denies the defendant's motion to rescind the Order for DNA surcharge. The defendant provides no authority for the proposition that the court's order for the DNA surcharge was in error. Even given the latitude that a Court should accord pleadings of a self represented person, the court is not obligated to develop the arguments and research authority for the relief sought.
From defendant regarding DNA Surcharge fees.
of the 3/10/15 Sentencing held before the Honorable Judge David J. Wambach (copy mailed to institution)
criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 9:31am [mo]
Defendant Erick Darnell Glenn in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Glenn guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Count #2, further the Court reads-in and dismisses an uncharged case with date of violation 12/29/14 (15JE225), and thereafter bars further prosecution of this referral.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Glenn

The Court sentences Mr. Glenn  to 4 1/2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  18  months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  3 years. This sentence is to commence forthwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   0  days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--No direct or indirect contact with Kimberly Lee or any of her children
--No contact with Steven Schroeder
--to undergo assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as directed by DOC
--No acts or threats of violence
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge


Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 10:15am
Status conference on March 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 18, 2015 at 09:40 am.
Scheduling Notice

Defendant Erick Darnell Glenn in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that there was a plea offer given, however new information arose yesterday. Atty. De La Rosa requests the scheduling of another Pre Trial Conference. 
The Court admonishes Mr. Glenn to rely on Atty. De La Rosa to advocate on his behalf, and to discontinue writing letters directly to the Court.

case called at 11:00am. [MK]
Defendant Erick Darnell Glenn in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy J Behm- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa


The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Glenn committed a felony. The Court binds him over for Trial. 
The Court grants Attorney De La Rosa's Motion to Extend Time for filing of pretrial motions unti.l 1/31/15. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered

Attorney De La Rosa orally motions for modification of bond to allow for Mr. Glenn to have contact with alleged victim K.L.  The Court requires that this motion be brought formally so that the State has notice and can contact the alleged victim K.L. 
The Court reminds Mr. Glenn that when he is released from custody next month, he needs to be sure to inform Attorney De La Rosa of his new address so that the Court can be notified of this. 
recess 11:26am. 

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/21/15 at 9:00am   (2) case is referred to Branch III for scheduling of a Status Conference after the Pretrial Date

case called at 8:44am. [MK]
Defendant Erick Darnell Glenn in court, in custody.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however Defense Attorney De La Rosa has contacted the Court to indicate that he is not able to appear today, however he will be available tomorrow for a rescheduled hearing.
The Court will reschedule. ADA Beck will check on witness availability regarding the time for tomorrow's hearing. 
recess 8:45am.
[Post-Hearing/Off Record:  Mr. Glenn indicates to the clerk that he is serving a sanction in the Jail until January 28th. ADA Beck indicates that Deputy Behm is available to testify as the State's witness tomorrow at 10:30am. ]

case called at 1:16pm. [MK]
Defendant Erick Darnell Glenn appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Glenn verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are accurate.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the felony charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000 signature bond, with conditions:
--not to commit any acts or threats of violence
--no contact Kimberly Lee
--no presence at 319 South Street, #5 in Johnson Creek, with the exception that Mr. Glenn may return there once with law enforcement to collection his personal belongings
--no possession of any dangerous weapons

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court informs the parties that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, then-DA Wambach and attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Glenn. The Court does not recognize or recall Mr. Glenn. The Court does not feel that disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess 1:33pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 12/3/14 at 10:20am  (2) schedule Preliminary Hearing after the Pretrial date
